schemas.description: A reference to the Device and Endpoint within the device (connection information) used by brokers to connect that provides data points for this asset.

fields.name: deviceName
fields.description: Name of the device resource.

fields.name: endpointName
fields.description: The name of endpoint to use.

fields.name: address
fields.description: The endpoint address to connect to.

fields.name: endpointType
fields.description: Type of connection used for the messaging endpoint.

fields.name: configuration
fields.description: The destination configuration.

fields.name: target
fields.description: The target destination.

fields.name: configuration
fields.description: The destination configuration.

fields.name: target
fields.description: The target destination.

fields.name: key
fields.description: The BrokerStateStore destination configuration key.

fields.name: path
fields.description: The Storage destination configuration path.

fields.name: qos
fields.description: The MQTT QoS setting.

fields.name: retain
fields.description: When set to 'Keep', messages published to an MQTT broker will have the retain flag set.

fields.name: topic
fields.description: The MQTT topic.

fields.name: ttl
fields.description: The MQTT TTL setting.

fields.name: schemaName
fields.description: The reference to the message schema name.

fields.name: schemaRegistryNamespace
fields.description: The reference to the message schema registry namespace.

fields.name: schemaVersion
fields.description: The reference to the message schema version.

fields.name: lastTransitionTime
fields.description: A read only timestamp indicating the last time the configuration has been modified from the perspective of the current actual (Edge) state of the CRD. Edge would be the only writer of this value and would sync back up to the cloud.

fields.name: version
fields.description: A read only incremental counter indicating the number of times the configuration has been modified from the perspective of the current actual (Edge) state of the CRD. Edge would be the only writer of this value and would sync back up to the cloud. In steady state, this should equal version.

fields.name: code
fields.description: Error code for classification of errors (ex: '400', '404', '500', etc.).

fields.name: details
fields.description: Array of error details that describe the status of each error.

fields.name: code
fields.description: Multi-part error code for classification and root causing of errors (ex: 400.200.100.432).

fields.name: correlationId
fields.description: Unique identifier for the transaction to aid in debugging.

fields.name: info
fields.description: Human readable helpful detailed text context for debugging (ex: “The following mechanisms are supported...”).

fields.name: message
fields.description: Human readable helpful error message to provide additional context for error (ex: “Authentication method not supported”).

fields.name: message
fields.description: Human readable helpful error message to provide additional context for error (ex: “capability Id ''foo'' does not exist”).

schemas.description: Represents a Device resource, modeled after the devices.namespaces.deviceregistry.microsoft.com CRD in Kubernetes.

fields.name: attributes
fields.description: A set of key-value pairs that contain custom attributes set by the customer.

fields.name: discoveredDeviceRef
fields.description: Reference to a device. Populated only if the device had been created from discovery flow. Discovered device name must be provided.

fields.name: enabled
fields.description: Indicates if the resource and identity are enabled or not. A disabled device cannot authenticate with Microsoft Entra ID.

fields.name: endpoints
fields.description: Connection endpoint url a device can use to connect to a service.

fields.name: additionalConfiguration
fields.description: Stringified JSON that contains connectivity type specific further configuration (e.g. OPC UA, ONVIF).

fields.name: address
fields.description: The endpoint address and port. This can be either an IP address (e.g., 192.168.1.1) or a fully qualified domain name (FQDN, e.g., server.example.com).

fields.name: authentication
fields.description: Defines the client authentication mechanism to the server.

fields.name: method
fields.description: Defines the method to authenticate the user of the client at the server.

fields.name: usernamePasswordCredentials
fields.description: The credentials for authentication mode UsernamePassword.

fields.name: usernameSecretName
fields.description: The name of the secret containing the username.

fields.name: passwordSecretName
fields.description: The name of the secret containing the password.

fields.name: x509Credentials
fields.description: The x509 certificate for authentication mode Certificate.

fields.name: certificateSecretName
fields.description: The name of the secret containing the certificate and private key (e.g. stored as .der/.pem or .der/.pfx).

fields.name: endpointType
fields.description: Type of connection endpoint.

fields.name: trustSettings
fields.description: Defines server trust settings for the endpoint.

fields.name: trustList
fields.description: Secret reference to certificates list to trust.

fields.name: version
fields.description: Version associated with device endpoint.

fields.name: outbound
fields.description: Set of endpoints for device to connect to.

fields.name: assigned
fields.description: Device messaging endpoint model.

fields.name: unassigned
fields.description: Device messaging endpoint model.

fields.name: externalDeviceId
fields.description: The Device ID provided by the customer.

fields.name: lastTransitionTime
fields.description: A timestamp (in UTC) that is updated each time the resource is modified.

fields.name: manufacturer
fields.description: Device manufacturer.

fields.name: model
fields.description: Device model.

fields.name: operatingSystem
fields.description: Device operating system.

fields.name: operatingSystemVersion
fields.description: Device operating system version.

fields.name: uuid
fields.description: Gets a unique identifier for this resource.

fields.name: version
fields.description: An integer that is incremented each time the resource is modified.

fields.name: endpoints
fields.description: Defines the device status for inbound/outbound endpoints.

mapValue.name: inboundEndpointStatus
mapValue.description: Defines the device status for specific endpoint.

fields.name: assetTypeRefs
fields.description: URIs or type definition IDs.

fields.name: attributes
fields.description: A set of key-value pairs that contain custom attributes set by the customer.

fields.name: datasets
fields.description: Array of data sets that are part of the asset. Each data set describes the data points that make up the set.

fields.name: dataPointConfiguration
fields.description: Stringified JSON that contains connector-specific configuration for the data point.

fields.name: dataSource
fields.description: The address of the source of the data in the asset (e.g. URL) so that a client can access the data source on the asset.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of the data point.

fields.name: typeRef
fields.description: URI or type definition ID.

fields.name: dataSource
fields.description: Name of the data source within a dataset.

fields.name: datasetConfiguration
fields.description: Stringified JSON that contains connector-specific JSON string that describes configuration for the specific dataset.

fields.name: destinations
fields.description: Destinations for a dataset.

fields.name: name
fields.description: Name of the dataset.

fields.name: typeRef
fields.description: URI or type definition ID.

fields.name: defaultDatasetsConfiguration
fields.description: Stringified JSON that contains connector-specific default configuration for all datasets. Each dataset can have its own configuration that overrides the default settings here.

fields.name: defaultDatasetsDestinations
fields.description: Default destinations for a dataset.

fields.name: defaultEventsConfiguration
fields.description: Stringified JSON that contains connector-specific default configuration for all events. Each event can have its own configuration that overrides the default settings here.

fields.name: defaultEventsDestinations
fields.description: Default destinations for an event.

fields.name: defaultManagementGroupsConfiguration
fields.description: Stringified JSON that contains connector-specific default configuration for all management groups. Each management group can have its own configuration that overrides the default settings here.

fields.name: defaultStreamsConfiguration
fields.description: Stringified JSON that contains connector-specific default configuration for all streams. Each stream can have its own configuration that overrides the default settings here.

fields.name: defaultStreamsDestinations
fields.description: Default destinations for a stream.

fields.name: description
fields.description: Human-readable description of the asset.

fields.name: deviceRef
fields.description: Reference to the device that provides data for this asset. Must provide device name and endpoint on the device to use.

fields.name: discoveredAssetRefs
fields.description: Reference to a list of discovered assets. Populated only if the asset has been created from discovery flow. Discovered asset names must be provided.

fields.name: displayName
fields.description: Human-readable display name.

fields.name: documentationUri
fields.description: Asset documentation reference.

fields.name: enabled
fields.description: Enabled/Disabled status of the asset.

fields.name: events
fields.description: Array of events that are part of the asset. Each event can have per-event configuration.

fields.name: dataPoints
fields.description: Array of data points that are part of the event. Each data point can have per-data-point configuration.

fields.name: dataPointConfiguration
fields.description: Stringified JSON that contains connector-specific configuration for the data point.

fields.name: dataSource
fields.description: The address of the source of the data in the event (e.g. URL) so that a client can access the data source on the asset.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of the data point.

fields.name: destinations
fields.description: Destinations for an event.

fields.name: eventConfiguration
fields.description: Stringified JSON that contains connector-specific configuration for the specific event.

fields.name: eventNotifier
fields.description: The address of the notifier of the event in the asset (e.g. URL) so that a client can access the notifier on the asset.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of the event.

fields.name: typeRef
fields.description: URI or type definition ID.

fields.name: externalAssetId
fields.description: Asset ID provided by the customer.

fields.name: hardwareRevision
fields.description: Asset hardware revision number.

fields.name: lastTransitionTime
fields.description: A timestamp (in UTC) that is updated each time the resource is modified.

fields.name: managementGroups
fields.description: Array of management groups that are part of the asset.

fields.name: actions
fields.description: Array of actions that are part of the management group. Each action can have an individual configuration.

fields.name: actionConfiguration
fields.description: Configuration for the action.

fields.name: actionType
fields.description: Type of the action.

fields.name: name
fields.description: Name of the action.

fields.name: targetUri
fields.description: The target URI on which a client can invoke the specific action.

fields.name: timeOutInSeconds
fields.description: Response timeout for the action.

fields.name: topic
fields.description: The MQTT topic path on which a client will receive the request for the action.

fields.name: typeRef
fields.description: URI or type definition ID.

fields.name: defaultTimeOutInSeconds
fields.description: Default response timeout for all actions that are part of the management group.

fields.name: defaultTopic
fields.description: Default MQTT topic path on which a client will receive the request for all actions that are part of the management group.

fields.name: managementGroupConfiguration
fields.description: Stringified JSON that contains connector-specific configuration for the management group.

fields.name: name
fields.description: Name of the management group.

fields.name: typeRef
fields.description: URI or type definition ID.

fields.name: manufacturer
fields.description: Asset manufacturer.

fields.name: manufacturerUri
fields.description: Asset manufacturer URI.

fields.name: model
fields.description: Asset model.

fields.name: productCode
fields.description: Asset product code.

fields.name: serialNumber
fields.description: Asset serial number.

fields.name: softwareRevision
fields.description: Asset software revision number.

fields.name: streams
fields.description: Array of streams that are part of the asset. Each stream can have per-stream configuration.

fields.name: destinations
fields.description: Destinations for a Stream.

fields.name: name
fields.description: Name of the stream definition.

fields.name: streamConfiguration
fields.description: Stringified JSON that contains connector-specific JSON string that describes configuration for the specific stream.

fields.name: typeRef
fields.description: URI or type definition ID.

fields.name: uuid
fields.description: Globally unique, immutable, non-reusable id.

fields.name: version
fields.description: A read-only integer that is incremented each time the resource is modified the cloud.

fields.name: config
fields.description: Defines the asset status config properties.

fields.name: datasets
fields.description: Array of dataset statuses that describe the status of each dataset.

fields.name: events
fields.description: Array of event statuses that describe the status of each event.

fields.name: managementGroups
fields.description: Array of management group statuses that describe the status of each management group.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of the action. Must be unique within the status.managementGroup[i].actions array. This name is used to correlate between the spec and status management group action information.

fields.name: requestMessageSchemaReference
fields.description: The request message schema reference object.

fields.name: responseMessageSchemaReference
fields.description: The response message schema reference object.

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of the managementgroup. Must be unique within the status.managementGroup array. This name is used to correlate between the spec and status management group information.

fields.name: streams
fields.description: Array of stream statuses that describe the status of each stream.

fields.name: error
fields.description: The configuration error

fields.name: messageSchemaReference
fields.description: The message schema reference object.

fields.name: manufacturer
fields.description: Asset manufacturer name.

fields.name: manufacturerUri
fields.description: URI to the manufacturer of the asset.

fields.name: model
fields.description: Asset model name.

fields.name: productCode
fields.description: Asset product code.

fields.name: serialNumber
fields.description: Asset serial number.

fields.name: softwareRevision
fields.description: Revision number of the software.
